item.title: Roblox: Trash Game Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Trash Game Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Trash Game
  • How to Get More Trash Game Codes

Trash Game is a Roblox experience in which you will play as a robot in an abandoned wasteland. You will need to explore the world, destroy enemies, collect trash and recycle it in your hideout to get materials. With these materials, you will be able to create improvements for your hideout and various parts for your robot, be it weapons or useful tools.

If you are eager to get new cool parts for your robot, or you don't have enough currency to upgrade, you can redeem the Trash Game codes we have collected for you below, as they will give you many free rewards.

All Trash Game Codes

Working Trash Game Codes

  • bigboatgame - Redeem this code to get 100 cash
  • iluvgreg - Redeem this code to get 100 cash

Expired Trash Game Codes

There are currently no expired Trash Game codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for Trash Game

The code redemption system in Trash Game is pretty straightforward and simple because it is similar to the one used in other Roblox games, so you shouldn't have any problems with it. However, if you do encounter any difficulties or can't find where to redeem codes, follow the step-by-step instructions below:

  • Firstly, launch Trash Game in Roblox .
  • When you open the game, pay attention to the upper right corner of the screen, where you will see the settings button.
  • Clicking on this button will bring up the settings menu with a field for entering codes topmost of it.
  • Enter, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above codes and press Enter.

If everything is done correctly, you will receive a notification with the reward. However, if this did not happen, and you cannot redeem one of the codes, it may be expired. Also, make sure that you entered the code correctly and that you didn't enter an extra space, as these are some of the most common mistakes.

How to Get More Trash Game Codes

To get more Roblox codes, we recommend you bookmark this page, as we update it regularly. You should also follow the game's official social media channels, as the developers occasionally post game codes along with news, announcements, and content about the game:

  • Official Trash Game Roblox group.
  • Official Trash Game Discord server.
  • Official Trash Game YouTube channel.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Stocking Spree Rewards And Milestones
item.description:

The Stocking Spree has just started in Scopely's Monopoly GO . It went live on December 09 and will be active for just 22 hours.

Running alongside the Mistletoe Magic banner event, the Stocking Spree tournament brings a plethora of rewards. These include dice, sticker packs of different varieties, and Prize Drop tokens. Find out all the rewards and milestones for the Stocking Spree tournament in the table below.

How To Get Points In Stocking Spree Monopoly GO

You can score tournament points by landing your board piece on the Railroad spaces on your board and completing your Shutdowns and Bank Heists. Here's what these minigames offer:

Shutdown

  • Blocked: Two Points
  • Successful: Four Points.

Bank Heist

  • Small: Four Points
  • Large: Six Points
  • Bankrupt: Eight Points.

item.title: Yakuza: Like a Dragon Series Gearing Up for 20th Anniversary
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Like a Dragon franchise will celebrate 20th anniversary.
  • An upcoming main series follow-up to Infinite Wealth likely to be announced soon.
  • Fans speculate potential game remakes and new game engine version for anticipated 2025 announcements.

The 20th anniversary of the Yakuza: Like a Dragon franchise is rapidly approaching, and the long-standing game series is gearing up accordingly. A new video from the lead of the team behind the Like a Dragon games has shared a bit of detail about how the studio will be celebrating the 20th anniversary.

Originating in 2005, the Like a Dragon series got its start on the PlayStation 2, launching in the west as simply Yakuza . While the series has enjoyed popularity in its home country of Japan since the get-go, the series had a rough run in the west early on, struggling to find its footing for many years. Yakuza 0 , the game's prequel, largely changed the fate of the series in English-speaking territories, serving as a new entry point for the Like a Dragon franchise and successfully impressing players with a captivating story, hilarious side quests, and years' worth of games to catch up on.

Now, Like a Dragon executive producer Masayoshi Yokoyama has spoken as the game has officially reached its 19th anniversary. In a brief video, Yokoyama explained that the series will be celebrating the approaching 20th anniversary throughout the year, promising "various events" and announcements in anticipation. The studio is also amping up its efforts around merchandising and content, with a "global structure" being established to better provide for fans around the world.

What Can Like a Dragon Fans Expect for the 20th Anniversary?

In the lead-up to the 20th anniversary of the series, RGG will be releasing Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii , with the title arriving in February. That game will put players back in the shoes of legendary ex-Yakuza Goro Majima as he enjoys an amnesiac rampage across Hawaii. However, RGG has remained largely silent regarding what games will launch after that.

While the future is unknown, there are some things fans are likely to see. A main series follow-up to Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth is likely to be announced in the coming year. If the 20th anniversary mirrors that of the 10th anniversary, players may also see announcements of game remakes. The 10th anniversary of the franchise led to Yakuza 0 and Yakuza Kiwami 's release, with the latter being a remake of the first game, and Yakuza Kiwami 2 , a remake of the second title, following not long after. As no games have received full remakes past that point, many would argue the PS3-launching Yakuza 3 is long overdue for an overhaul.

Outside of that, execs at RGG have discussed the possibility of a new version of the engine that the Like a Dragon games run off of, as the current engine originated during that 10th anniversary period. Whatever the future holds, it seems like a lot of exciting news will arrive in 2025 for fans of the long-running series.

item.title: Why Dead by Daylight's Teamwork Perks Face a Slippery Slope
item.description:
Teamwork perks have barely been touched upon in Dead by Daylight , but their future already looks uncertain due to a few circumstances. Granted, not every perk in Dead by Daylight is going to be relevant in the meta. Considering the sheer amount of perks, that would be impossible. However, Teamwork perks come with a few drawbacks that hold them back compared to almost all other Survivor perks. At the very least, they have a few issues that need to be ironed out; at worst, Dead by Daylight may not end up putting out any more Teamwork perks.

Introduced in Dead by Daylight 's Tools of Torment update, Teamwork perks are one of the rarest types in the game, with only two existing so far. Those perks are Teamwork: Collective Stealth and Teamwork: Power of Two. It should be noted that both of these perks came out with Tools of Torment, with no other Teamwork perks being introduced since. Seeing as it has now been over a year since any Teamwork perks were released, their place in the game may be in a shaky position.

There are also only two Invocation perks and not only are Invocations newer but the second one released in the latest chapter.

Dead by Daylight's Two Teamwork Perks Have Some Major Problems

Dead by Daylight's Teamwork Perks are Cumbersome to Use

One prominent flaw of Teamwork perk design in Dead by Daylight is their activation requirements. Collective Stealth requires the user to be healed by someone else, while Power of two requires the user to successfully heal someone. Not only that, but the perk effects only remain in place as long as the user and the other person involved remain near each other. The actual effects, hiding scratch marks and a haste bonus, respectively, are decent, but not strong enough to offset the steep requirements. At the moment, both Teamwork perks are completely outclassed by other perks with similar effects.

Teamwork Perks Need a Rework to Be More Efficient

Some serious reworks may need to be done in Dead by Daylight 's future in order to Teamwork perks to become relevant. Specifically, both of their requirements combined are far too restrictive. One possibility is for the perks to trigger a temporary boost that isn't restricted by proximity, while another option is to have an effect similar to Dwight's Leader perk, having a good effect that only works within a small radius to balance it out. Future Teamwork perks, as well as reworks of the first two, could take this into account. By doing so, they may have a chance to become more widely used.

Survivor Lore Could Make Finding New Teamwork Perks Harder

Teamwork perks face another obstacle unrelated to gameplay, and that is the backstories of Dead by Daylight 's Survivors. The Survivors who came with the Teamwork perks, Renato and Thalita, were brother and sister and it makes sense that they would have at least one perk that revolves around working together. Another Teamwork perk would likely require another duo of Survivors or a Survivor who has a backstory involving working as a team or having tight bonds with others. Otherwise, such a perk may feel out of place. It's an unexpected complication, but one that makes Teamwork perks somewhat hard to place on new Survivors.

Among Dead by Daylight 's perk types, they are likely the most overlooked because they don't stand out in any way. They aren't plentiful, and any niche role they might have is overshadowed by less situational perks. That said, future Teamwork perks will definitely need a change in design to have any impact in Dead by Daylight .

item.title: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete - How to Get Gifts
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Get Gifts
    • What Level Do Animals Give Gifts?
  • How to Get Camper Cards
    • How to Receive Gifts from Villagers
  • What Can You Get from Gifts?

Completing requests and Blathers's Treasure Trek isn't the only way to obtain crafting materials in Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete . If your friendship is high enough with the animals, they may give you a gift the next time you speak with them. However, speaking to animals isn't the only way to obtain a gift or two. You'll want to start expanding your Camper Cards and register other players in Pocket Camp Complete . More villagers and animals means more materials, which you'll absolutely need to craft furniture and clothing.

The type of gifts mentioned in this guide are different from the gifts you can send and receive from friends in Pocket Camp .

Where to Get Gifts

What Level Do Animals Give Gifts?

As mentioned, you can get gifts from animals in Pocket Camp Complete . Once your friendship is high enough, you may receive a message when you warp to your campsite or cabin. This will display a row of villagers that are currently in your camp. You'll want to speak with them and select " Tell me a story !" to potentially receive a gift. You'll also earn some friendship points.

Your animal friend will give gifts so long as you speak to them at your campsite/cabin. If you've been fulfilling requests or raising their friendship regularly, then they'll have a higher chance of giving you a gift. Thus, it's important to keep leveling friendship and using Pete's Parcel Service to complete requests in bulk.

If you see "Tell me a story!" and select it, bear in mind that they may not always have a gift for you. Sometimes they'll want you to choose a gift for another villager. Typically, any dialogue prompts in red text will give your friendship with that animal a small boost.

Another way to get gifts is to open your menu . Occasionally, you'll see a package with a red or gold balloon . Tapping them will allow you to receive crafting materials/essence. If you see a gold balloon, you may even get a treasure map , which can be used for Blathers's Treasure Trek. Treasure maps are another method of obtaining materials and bells, but if you get a rare map, you can meet new animals you wouldn't find anywhere else.

You can also get gifts from your Camp Caretaker . You can set a helper by doing the following:

  1. Open the menu , and tap the camper icon in the bottom right corner of the screen.
  2. You can choose to Change Animal if you want a new Camp Caretaker.
    1. If you select Relieve as Camp Caretaker , you'll go without a caretaker until you assign someone. During this, you won't be able to receive any gifts from your caretaker since there won't be any.

How to Get Camper Cards

How to Receive Gifts from Villagers

You should register Camper Cards in Pocket Camp Complete . Normally, you'd have to get a Camper Card from someone online or offline, but if you're struggling, there are ways around this. You can visit Pocket Camp Complete 's official website and register 10 free Camper Cards .

  1. Scroll down to the images with the QR codes (in the above link) and save them to your camera roll . If you have camera roll accessibility enabled on your phone, then you should be able to scan them directly from Pocket Camp Complete .
  2. In Pocket Camp Complete , select Cards in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
  3. Select an empty Camper Card, and you'll be prompted to Scan QR code. Select Images and pull up the QR code.

There's also a direct link to the official website when you go to register a Camper Card.

Once you have some Camper Cards, you can go to Whistle Pass and speak with them. Usually, the first villager you speak to will give you a gift. You'll receive a furniture item that matches the theme of any in-game event. You will also receive a variety of materials, including Friend Powder, which can be tricky to obtain anywhere else.

What Can You Get from Gifts?

Materials & Bells

Gifts normally obtain crafting materials, but the type of materials will depend on the type of animal. For example, Goldie (dog) will give Natural Essence and Steel crafting materials. This will differ from an animal such as Apple (hamster), who gives Cute Essence and Wood materials. Sometimes you'll only receive a bag of Bells instead of materials.

Your Camp Caretaker will give you materials based on their species and type (ex: Natural, Hip). However, you may also receive collectible items such as bugs or fish.
